description: From Middle English sich like, suche-like, swylk lyk; equivalent to such +‎ like.

entries.meaning: Of the same or similar kind.
examples: If there bee neuer a Seruant-monſter i' the Fayre, who can helpe it, he ſayes ; nor a neſt of Antiques ?   Hee is loth to make Nature afraid in his Playes, like thoſe that beget Tales, Tempeſts, and ſuch like Drolleries,  […]
